text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zimbabwe press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The Treasury, already battling to tame the government's runaway spending, will more than double to Z$65 million the financial allocation this fiscal year to the ruling ZANU-PF party under the controversial Political Parties (Finance) Act.
- A foreign investor is acquiring three of Falcon Gold Zimbabwe's mines at a cost of over Z$78 million.
- Seed Co Ltd, Zimbabwe's largest seed producing company, is investing over Z$60 million in a seed house in South Africa as it strengthens its position in the region.
- The Supreme Court reserved judgment on Wednesday on an application by the opposition United Parties which sought a declaration that sections of the Electoral Act were unconstitutional.
- Eight people, including a six-month-old baby, died on Wednesday while 12 others were badly hurt when a Harare-bound bus collided with a fuel tanker near the eastern town of Rusape.
